title: Ticket #4066: batch_test.pl: Repeated runs slow down tests
description:
If you run the the full set of tests repeatedly (say, because you're bisecting a bug, or just doing incremental development), the tests will eventually get unusably slow, going from taking a few hours to taking a day or more. This should be fixed.

Hypothesis: the problem is that various log files continue to accumulate between runs, and the testing code is re-reading them from the start, probably repeatedly. If this is the case, ideally each test should set LOG to a private directory; failing that when a test finishes, it should move the logs to a private directory to leave LOG ready for the next test. This will probably increase the speed of all tests.
remarks:
2013-Nov-14 14:20:04 by adesmet:
bt believes --isolated will solve the problem; tests won't share a single set of log files. Testing now. Considering if this should be the default.
